sense.name: a dissolute man of fashionable society, a rake
sense.examples: The duchess carried on a long-term affair with an English rip from London. The father brandished a pistol and demanded the old rip leave his daughter alone.

sense.name: a tear, split or rent in an object
sense.examples: I don't think the rip in John's shirt can be mended. The surgeon advised quiet activity for a week to avoid a possible rip in the sutures.

sense.name: a strong, turbulent current
sense.examples: Be careful of the rip tides on that beach. The current that runs parallel to the shore here is a rip.

sense.name: the destructive act of tearing, renting apart
sense.examples: With a rip she tore the fabric into two pieces. He gave the box top a rip to remove the seal.

sense.name: a swindle, a fraudulent gesture
sense.examples: The audience felt the show was kind of a rip because the singer only performed for 30 minutes. Be careful that this job offer on the Internet is not just another rip.
